info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 26 at 9:14AM EST until December 27 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a Flood Advisory for the French Broad River Near Fletcher affecting Buncombe and Henderson Counties... ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT THROUGH TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...French Broad River near Fletcher. * WHEN...From this morning through tonight. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, the river exceeds bankfull at the gauge site. Isolated farmland flooding is beginning across the French Broad River Valley from Etowah downstream to Avery Creek upstream of the gauge site. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.5 feet this evening. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement issuance will occur by this evening at 915 PM EST.
